Method Detail

apsp

public static <T> void apsp(Digraph dg,
                            EdgeMap<T> weights,
                            NodeMatrix<T> m,
                            NumAdaptor<T> adaptor)
Compute the all pairs shortests paths distances of a digraph with edge weights. If the graph is sparse, then apspSparse(temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Digraph, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.EdgeMap, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.NodeMatrix, temp.fibHeap.stixar.util.NumAdaptor) is used, otherwise apspDense(temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Digraph, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.EdgeSource, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.NodeMatrix, temp.fibHeap.stixar.util.NumAdaptor) is used.

Parameters:
dg - the digraph whose shortests path distances are to be computed.
weights - an edge attribute map giving graph edges weights.
m - a NodeMatrix in which to store shortest path distances from node i to node j in cell (i,j).
adaptor - a shortests path adaptor providing addition and comparison for the type T.

apspSparse

public static <T> Path apspSparse(Digraph digraph,
                                  EdgeMap<T> weights,
                                  NodeMatrix<T> m,
                                  NumAdaptor<T> adaptor)
Compute all pairs shortests paths distances using Johnson's algorithm. First, a copy of the input graph is made and the copy is augmented with a new source vertex and edges from it to every other node with weight zero. Then apspSparse(temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Digraph, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.EdgeMap, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.NodeMatrix, temp.fibHeap.stixar.util.NumAdaptor) is called with new source vertex.

Parameters:
digraph - the digraph whose shortests path distances are to be computed.
weights - an edge attribute map giving graph edges weights.
m - a NodeMatrix in which to store shortest path distances from node i to node j in cell (i,j).
adaptor - a shortests path adaptor providing addition and comparison for the type T.
Returns:
a Path containing a negative cycle in dg, or null if the computation is successful.

apspSparse

public static <T> Path apspSparse(Digraph dg,
                                  Node source,
                                  EdgeMap<T> weights,
                                  NodeMatrix<T> m,
                                  NumAdaptor<T> adaptor)
Compute all pairs shortests paths distances using Johnson's algorithm. First a potential function is found using SSSP.arbw(temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Digraph, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Node, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.NodeMap, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.EdgeSource, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.NodeMap, temp.fibHeap.stixar.util.NumAdaptor). If this is successful, then the potential function is used to reduce the single source shortests path problem for arbitrary weights to the single source shortests path problem for positive edge weights. Subsequently, SSSP.dijkstra(temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Graph, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.Node, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.NodeMap, temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.attr.EdgeSource, temp.fibHeap.stixar.util.NumAdaptor) is called for every node.

Complexity: O(nm + n2log n).

Parameters:
dg - the digraph whose shortests path distances are to be computed.
source - a vertex which can reach every other vertex in dg.
weights - an edge attribute map giving graph edges weights.
m - a NodeMatrix in which to store shortest path distances from node i to node j in cell (i,j).
adaptor - a shortests path adaptor providing addition and comparison for the type T.
Returns:
a Path containing a negative cycle in dg, or null if the computation is successful.

apspDense

public static <T> void apspDense(Digraph dg,
                                 EdgeSource<T> weights,
                                 NodeMatrix<T> m,
                                 NumAdaptor<T> adaptor)
Compute all pairs shortests paths with Floyd-Warshall algorithm. For every pair of nodes (i,j), compute the distance of the shortest path from i to j, storing the result in a node matrix. The algorithm runs in O(n3). If shortests paths are not well defined due to the existance of a negative cycle, the matrix storing the shortests paths distances will contain an entry (i,i) whose value is negative for some node i.

Parameters:
dg - the digraph whose shortests path distances are to be computed.
weights - an edge attribute map giving graph edges weights.
m - a NodeMatrix in which to store shortest path distances from node i to node j in cell (i,j).
adaptor - a shortests path adaptor providing addition and comparison for the type T.

dynApspDense

public static <T> void dynApspDense(Digraph dg,
                                    Edge e,
                                    EdgeSource<T> weights,
                                    NodeMatrix<T> m,
                                    NumAdaptor<T> adaptor)
Incrememtal APSP for dense graphs. Compute incrementally all pairs shortests paths for a dense graph, provided with an initial node matrix containing all pairs shortests paths distances and an edge whose weight has decreased. Before a call to this function, the new edge weight is not reflected in the node matrix. This method updates the matrix to reflect the reduced edge weight in O(n2) time.

Parameters:
dg - the digraph whose shortests path distances are to be updated.
e - an edge whose weight has been reduced in weights.
weights - an edge attribute map giving graph edges weights.
m - a NodeMatrix in which shortest paths distances from from node i to node j in cell (i,j) are stored. The matrix should contain the distances prior to a decrease in edge weight for edge e.
adaptor - a shortests path adaptor providing addition and comparison for the type T.
